verses.verse: וַתֵּ֣רֶא <WH7200> wat·tê·re saw ( Dan and Naphtali) רָחֵ֗ל <WH7354> rā·ḥêl When Rachel כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî that לֹ֤א <WH3808> lō she was not יָֽלְדָה֙ <WH3205> yā·lə·ḏāh bearing לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ for Jacob, וַתְּקַנֵּ֥א <WH7065> wat·tə·qan·nê she envied רָחֵ֖ל <WH7354> rā·ḥêl any children בַּאֲחֹתָ֑הּ <WH269> ba·’ă·ḥō·ṯāh her sister. וַתֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer she said אֶֽל־ <WH413> ’el- to יַעֲקֹב֙ <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ Jacob. הָֽבָה־ <WH3051> hā·ḇāh- “ Give לִּ֣י Prep│1cs ( lî) me בָנִ֔ים 1121 N-mp ( ḇā·nîm) children, וְאִם־ 518 Conj ( wə·’im-) or אַ֖יִן 369 Adv ( ’a·yin) ... מֵתָ֥ה 4191 V-Qal-Prtcpl-fs ( mê·ṯāh) will die! ” אָנֹֽכִי׃ 595 Pro-1cs ( ’ā·nō·ḵî) I

וַיִּֽחַר־ <WH2734> way·yi·ḥar- became angry אַ֥ף <WH639> ’ap̄ ... יַעֲקֹ֖ב <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ Jacob בְּרָחֵ֑ל <WH7354> bə·rā·ḥêl with Rachel וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer and said, הֲתַ֤חַת <WH8478> hă·ṯa·ḥaṯ in the place אֱלֹהִים֙ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm of God, אָנֹ֔כִי <WH595> ’ā·nō·ḵî “ Am I אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- who מָנַ֥ע <WH4513> mā·na‘ has withheld מִמֵּ֖ךְ <WH4480> mim·mêḵ from you? ” פְּרִי־ <WH6529> pə·rî- children בָֽטֶן׃ <WH990> ḇā·ṭen ...

וַתֹּ֕אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer Then she said, הִנֵּ֛ה <WH2009> hin·nêh “ Here אֲמָתִ֥י <WH519> ’ă·mā·ṯî is my maidservant בִלְהָ֖ה <WH1090> ḇil·hāh Bilhah. בֹּ֣א <WH935> bō Sleep with אֵלֶ֑יהָ <WH413> ’ê·le·hā her, וְתֵלֵד֙ <WH3205> wə·ṯê·lêḏ that she may bear children עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- vvv בִּרְכַּ֔י <WH1290> bir·kay [for me], ( Literally bear children on my knees) וְאִבָּנֶ֥ה <WH1129> wə·’ib·bā·neh can build a family. ” גַם־ <WH1571> ḡam- too אָנֹכִ֖י <WH595> ’ā·nō·ḵî I מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ <WH4480> mim·men·nāh so that through her

וַתִּתֶּן־ <WH5414> wat·tit·ten- So Rachel gave ל֛וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) - אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) [Jacob] בִּלְהָ֥ה 1090 N-proper-fs ( bil·hāh) Bilhah שִׁפְחָתָ֖הּ 8198 N-fsc│3fs ( šip̄·ḥā·ṯāh) her servant לְאִשָּׁ֑ה 802 Prep-l│N-fs ( lə·’iš·šāh) as a wife, וַיָּבֹ֥א 935 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3ms ( way·yā·ḇō) slept with אֵלֶ֖יהָ 413 Prep│3fs ( ’ê·le·hā) her, יַעֲקֹֽב׃ 3290 N-proper-ms ( ya·‘ă·qōḇ) and [he]
וַתַּ֣הַר <WH2029> wat·ta·har conceived בִּלְהָ֔ה <WH1090> bil·hāh and Bilhah וַתֵּ֥לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ and bore לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ [him] בֵּֽן׃ <WH1121> bên a son.

וַתֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said, רָחֵל֙ <WH7354> rā·ḥêl Then Rachel דָּנַ֣נִּי <WH1777> dā·nan·nî has vindicated me; אֱלֹהִ֔ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm “ God וְגַם֙ <WH1571> wə·ḡam - שָׁמַ֣ע <WH8085> šā·ma‘ He has heard בְּקֹלִ֔י <WH6963> bə·qō·lî my plea וַיִּתֶּן־ <WH5414> way·yit·ten- and given לִ֖י Prep│1cs ( lî) me בֵּ֑ן 1121 N-ms ( bên) a son. ” עַל־ 5921 Prep ( ‘al-) ... כֵּ֛ן 3651 Adv ( kên) ... קָרְאָ֥ה 7121 V-Qal-Perf-3fs ( qā·rə·’āh) So she named him שְׁמ֖וֹ 8034 N-msc│3ms ( šə·mōw) ... דָּֽן׃ 1835 N-proper-ms ( dān) Dan.

וַתַּ֣הַר <WH2029> wat·ta·har conceived ע֔וֹד <WH5750> ‘ō·wḏ again וַתֵּ֕לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ and bore בִּלְהָ֖ה <WH1090> bil·hāh Bilhah שִׁפְחַ֣ת <WH8198> šip̄·ḥaṯ servant רָחֵ֑ל <WH7354> rā·ḥêl And Rachel’s בֵּ֥ן <WH1121> bên son. שֵׁנִ֖י <WH8145> šê·nî a second לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃ <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ Jacob

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said, רָחֵ֗ל <WH7354> rā·ḥêl Then Rachel נַפְתּוּלֵ֨י <WH5319> nap̄·tū·lê “ In my great struggles אֱלֹהִ֧ים׀ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm ..., נִפְתַּ֛לְתִּי <WH6617> nip̄·tal·tî I have wrestled עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- with אֲחֹתִ֖י <WH269> ’ă·ḥō·ṯî my sister גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- and יָכֹ֑לְתִּי <WH3201> yā·ḵō·lə·tî won. ” וַתִּקְרָ֥א <WH7121> wat·tiq·rā So she named שְׁמ֖וֹ <WH8034> šə·mōw him נַפְתָּלִֽי׃ <WH5321> nap̄·tā·lî Naphtali. ( Naphtali sounds like the Hebrew for wrestling.)

וַתֵּ֣רֶא <WH7200> wat·tê·re saw ( Gad and Asher) לֵאָ֔ה <WH3812> lê·’āh When Leah כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî that עָמְדָ֖ה <WH5975> ‘ā·mə·ḏāh she had stopped מִלֶּ֑דֶת <WH3205> mil·le·ḏeṯ having children, וַתִּקַּח֙ <WH3947> wat·tiq·qaḥ vvv אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - זִלְפָּ֣ה <WH2153> zil·pāh Zilpah שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ <WH8198> šip̄·ḥā·ṯāh her servant וַתִּתֵּ֥ן <WH5414> wat·tit·tên she gave אֹתָ֛הּ <WH853> ’ō·ṯāh - לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ to Jacob לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ <WH802> lə·’iš·šāh as a wife.

וַתֵּ֗לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ bore זִלְפָּ֛ה <WH2153> zil·pāh Zilpah שִׁפְחַ֥ת <WH8198> šip̄·ḥaṯ servant לֵאָ֖ה <WH3812> lê·’āh And Leah’s לְיַעֲקֹ֥ב <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ Jacob בֵּֽן׃ <WH1121> bên a son.

וַתֹּ֥אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said, לֵאָ֖ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Then Leah בְּגָד <WH935> bə·ḡå̄ḏ “ How fortunate! ” ( Alternate MT reading (see also LXX); the other alternate reads “A troop is coming!”) וַתִּקְרָ֥א <WH7121> wat·tiq·rā So she named אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - שְׁמ֖וֹ <WH8034> šə·mōw him גָּֽד׃ <WH1410> gāḏ Gad. ( Gad sounds like the Hebrew for good fortune, or alternately for band of raiders.)

וַתֵּ֗לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ bore זִלְפָּה֙ <WH2153> zil·pāh Zilpah שִׁפְחַ֣ת <WH8198> šip̄·ḥaṯ servant לֵאָ֔ה <WH3812> lê·’āh When Leah’s בֵּ֥ן <WH1121> bên son, שֵׁנִ֖י <WH8145> šê·nî a second לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃ <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ Jacob

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said, לֵאָ֔ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Leah בְּאָשְׁרִ֕י <WH837> bə·’ā·šə·rî “ How happy I am! כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî For אִשְּׁר֖וּנִי <WH833> ’iš·šə·rū·nî call me happy. ” בָּנ֑וֹת <WH1323> bā·nō·wṯ the women וַתִּקְרָ֥א <WH7121> wat·tiq·rā So she named אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - שְׁמ֖וֹ <WH8034> šə·mōw him אָשֵֽׁר׃ <WH836> ’ā·šêr Asher. ( Asher means happy.)

וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ <WH1980> way·yê·leḵ went out רְאוּבֵ֜ן <WH7205> rə·’ū·ḇên Reuben בִּימֵ֣י <WH3117> bî·mê ... קְצִיר־ <WH7105> qə·ṣîr- harvest, חִטִּ֗ים <WH2406> ḥiṭ·ṭîm Now during the wheat וַיִּמְצָ֤א <WH4672> way·yim·ṣā and found דֽוּדָאִים֙ <WH1736> ḏū·ḏā·’îm some mandrakes בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה <WH7704> baś·śā·ḏeh in the field. וַיָּבֵ֣א <WH935> way·yā·ḇê When he brought אֹתָ֔ם <WH853> ’ō·ṯām them אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to לֵאָ֖ה <WH3812> lê·’āh -, אִמּ֑וֹ <WH517> ’im·mōw his mother וַתֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer begged רָחֵל֙ <WH7354> rā·ḥêl Rachel אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... לֵאָ֔ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Leah, תְּנִי־ <WH5414> tə·nî- give me נָ֣א <WH4994> nā “ Please לִ֔י Prep│1cs ( lî) some of מִדּוּדָאֵ֖י 1736 Prep-m│N-mpc ( mid·dū·ḏā·’ê) mandrakes. ” בְּנֵֽךְ׃ 1121 N-msc│2fs ( bə·nêḵ) your son’s

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer But Leah replied לָ֗הּ Prep│3fs ( lāh) , הַמְעַט֙ 4592 Art│Adj-ms ( ham·‘aṭ) “ Is it not enough קַחְתֵּ֣ךְ 3947 V-Qal-Inf│2fs ( qaḥ·têḵ) that you have taken away אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - אִישִׁ֔י 376 N-msc│1cs ( ’î·šî) my husband? וְלָקַ֕חַת 3947 Conj-w, Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf ( wə·lā·qa·ḥaṯ) want to take גַּ֥ם 1571 Conj ( gam) Now you אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - דּוּדָאֵ֖י 1736 N-mpc ( dū·ḏā·’ê) mandrakes [as well]? ” בְּנִ֑י 1121 N-msc│1cs ( bə·nî) my son’s וַתֹּ֣אמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tō·mer) said רָחֵ֗ל 7354 N-proper-fs ( rā·ḥêl) Rachel, לָכֵן֙ 3651 Adv ( lā·ḵên) “ Very well, ” יִשְׁכַּ֤ב 7901 V-Qal-Imperf-3ms ( yiš·kaḇ) “ he may sleep עִמָּךְ֙ 5973 Prep│2fs ( ‘im·māḵ) with you הַלַּ֔יְלָה 3915 Art│N-ms ( hal·lay·lāh) tonight תַּ֖חַת 8478 Prep ( ta·ḥaṯ) in exchange for דּוּדָאֵ֥י 1736 N-mpc ( dū·ḏā·’ê) mandrakes. ” בְנֵֽךְ׃ 1121 N-msc│2fs ( ḇə·nêḵ) your son’s

וַיָּבֹ֨א <WH935> way·yā·ḇō came in יַעֲקֹ֣ב <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ When Jacob מִן־ <WH4480> min- from הַשָּׂדֶה֮ <WH7704> haś·śā·ḏeh the field בָּעֶרֶב֒ <WH6153> bā·‘e·reḇ that evening, וַתֵּצֵ֨א <WH3318> wat·tê·ṣê went out לֵאָ֜ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Leah לִקְרָאת֗וֹ <WH7122> liq·rā·ṯōw to meet him וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ <WH559> wat·tō·mer and said, אֵלַ֣י <WH413> ’ê·lay with me, תָּב֔וֹא <WH935> tā·ḇō·w “ You must come כִּ֚י <WH3588> kî for שָׂכֹ֣ר <WH7936> śā·ḵōr I have hired you שְׂכַרְתִּ֔יךָ <WH7936> śə·ḵar·tî·ḵā ... בְּדוּדָאֵ֖י <WH1736> bə·ḏū·ḏā·’ê mandrakes. ” בְּנִ֑י <WH1121> bə·nî with my son’s וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב <WH7901> way·yiš·kaḇ So [he] slept עִמָּ֖הּ <WH5973> ‘im·māh with her בַּלַּ֥יְלָה <WH3915> bal·lay·lāh night. הֽוּא׃ <WH1931> hū that

וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע <WH8085> way·yiš·ma‘ listened ( Issachar, Zebulun, and Dinah) אֱלֹהִ֖ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm And God אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to לֵאָ֑ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Leah, וַתַּ֛הַר <WH2029> wat·ta·har and she conceived וַתֵּ֥לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ and bore לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב <WH3290> lə·ya·‘ă·qōḇ to Jacob. בֵּ֥ן <WH1121> bên son חֲמִישִֽׁי׃ <WH2549> ḥă·mî·šî a fifth

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said, לֵאָ֗ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Then Leah נָתַ֤ן <WH5414> nā·ṯan has rewarded me אֱלֹהִים֙ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm “ God שְׂכָרִ֔י <WH7939> śə·ḵā·rî ... אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- for נָתַ֥תִּי <WH5414> nā·ṯat·tî giving שִׁפְחָתִ֖י <WH8198> šip̄·ḥā·ṯî my maidservant לְאִישִׁ֑י <WH376> lə·’î·šî to my husband. ” וַתִּקְרָ֥א <WH7121> wat·tiq·rā So she named him שְׁמ֖וֹ <WH8034> šə·mōw ... יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃ <WH3485> yiś·śā·š·ḵār Issachar. ( Issachar sounds like the Hebrew for wages or reward.)

וַתַּ֤הַר <WH2029> wat·ta·har conceived עוֹד֙ <WH5750> ‘ō·wḏ Again לֵאָ֔ה <WH3812> lê·’āh Leah וַתֵּ֥לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ and bore בֵּן־ <WH1121> bên- son שִׁשִּׁ֖י <WH8345> šiš·šî a sixth לְּיַעֲקֹֽב׃ <WH3290> lə·ya·ʿă·qōḇ to Jacob.

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said. לֵאָ֗ה <WH3812> lê·’āh [she] זְבָדַ֨נִי <WH2064> zə·ḇā·ḏa·nî has given me אֱלֹהִ֥ים׀ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm “ God אֹתִי֮ <WH853> ’ō·ṯî - זֵ֣בֶד <WH2065> zê·ḇeḏ gift, ” טוֹב֒ <WH2896> ṭō·wḇ a good הַפַּ֙עַם֙ <WH6471> hap·pa·‘am “ This time יִזְבְּלֵ֣נִי <WH2082> yiz·bə·lê·nî will honor me, אִישִׁ֔י <WH376> ’î·šî my husband כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- because יָלַ֥דְתִּי <WH3205> yā·laḏ·tî I have borne ל֖וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) him שִׁשָּׁ֣ה 8337 Number-ms ( šiš·šāh) six בָנִ֑ים 1121 N-mp ( ḇā·nîm) sons. ” וַתִּקְרָ֥א 7121 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tiq·rā) And she named אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - שְׁמ֖וֹ 8034 N-msc│3ms ( šə·mōw) him זְבֻלֽוּן׃ 2074 N-proper-ms ( zə·ḇu·lūn) Zebulun.
